choices.answer: Selling to, buying from and operating in multiple countries.
The process of converting one currency to another.
The process of gaining capital from outside a business.
The process of gaining capital from inside a business.
The location of producing goods and services.
The flow of goods and services into a country from another.
The flow of goods and services out of a country.

questions.question: Advantages of imports are... (more than one answer)

choices.answer: An increased product range
Domestic suppliers may go out of business.
Raw materials may be cheaper from abroad
Selling to customers abroad.

questions.question: Key UK imports include...(More than one correct answer)

choices.answer: Cheshire Cheese
Stilton cheese
Clothing
Coffee beans
The flow of goods and services into a country from another.
The goods and services brought into a domestic business.
The goods brought into a country from abroad.
The flow of goods and services out of a country to another.

questions.question: UK imports = £60bn. UK exports = £40bn. What is the value of net imports?

choices.answer: £20bn
£10bn

questions.question: What does the term domestic market mean?

choices.answer: Opportunity to sell goods to foreign markets.
The amount of customers working in businesses.
A business's home or main country to trade in.
When businesses gain international recognition.

questions.question: What do we mean by the term offshoring?

choices.answer: A business who moves its  whole operation to another country
Selling to customers abroad
Producing all goods and services in the domestic market
The ability to sell working contracts to other countries.

questions.question: Why might a company choose to offshore their operations? (more than one answer)

choices.answer: To potentially reduce costs
To enter new markets
To make operations between countries more complicated
To increase prices of goods and services
A benefit to businesses who trade internationally
A location where labour costs are low
A product made overseas
A tax imposed by a country on imports
Promotes trade between member nations
Can be used to control employees in different countries.
Is an agreement between every country in the world
A set of businesses that trade between many countries.
